comment: She took forever to put in grades for assignments weeks prior and she gives not the most respectful feedback on assignments. I also did not appreciate the tone in many of her announcements on D2l. She waited to enter final grades two weeks after my other professors had already had my final grade submitted through the college.
Not a lot of assignments, but grades somewhat harshly. However, the content is manageable and the assignments are not that hard.

Dr. Likely seemed to have favorites in her class. Her attendance policy is unnecessary, she takes off one point of your final grade for each day that you miss. Be prepared to be called on, she makes sure every student in the class participates at the end of every class. Grades work based on if she likes you or not. Take Dr. Collins instead.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I withdrew from this course after staying in the hospital with a family member because she wouldn't let me submit missing assignments. It's very easy to fall behind in this class because there are many assignments per week and 1-2 typically take a few days to complete

She has a STRICT attendance policy. 5 points per class missed on the final grade. She can be flexible and grades a bit on the harsher side. She is willing to help you & be flexible if you ask. Discussions every week, a few projects and a lot of peer feedback - which can be harsh on its own.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Likely is sweet, but she is a super tough grader. She makes it seem like she's super chill, but she's not. If you miss one class it's 5 points off your total final grade, even if you let her know before. She also will call you out in front of the class to answer questions if nobody raises their hand. She will give extensions on assignments tho.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Likely is very kind and relatable and genuine. She's not there to trick you, she really wants you to succeed. THE MOST helpful professor in the ECE department in my opinion. There is no reason to fail her class, she's very easy. flexible attendance, just communicate and don't make a habit of skipping, you won't want to anyways. Slow grader tho.
